com.tokelon.toktales.core.engine.input

Interface IInputRegistration

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAndroidGameStateInput, IAndroidInputConsumer, IAndroidInputRegistration, IDesktopGameStateInput, IDesktopInputConsumer, IDesktopInputRegistration, IGameStateInput, IInputConsumer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndroidGameStateInput, AndroidInputConsumer, AndroidInputRegistration, DesktopGameStateInput, DesktopInputConsumer, DesktopInputRegistration

    public interface IInputRegistration

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasInputCallback(IInputCallback callback)
      Checks if the given callback is registered as any type.
      <T extends IInputCallback>
      boolean      		 hasInputCallback(T callback, Class<T> callbackType)
      Checks if the given callback is registered as the given type.
      boolean registerInputCallback(IInputCallback callback)
      Registers the given callback for all types possible.
      <T extends IInputCallback>
      boolean      		 registerInputCallback(T callback, Class<T> callbackType)
      Registers the given callback for the given type, if possible.

      Registers the given callback if possible.

      Unregisters the given callback for the given type.

    • Method Detail

      • registerInputCallback

        boolean registerInputCallback(IInputCallback callback)
        Registers the given callback for all types possible. Registration will not be possible if the callback does not implement any supported types.
        Parameters:
        callback -
        Returns:
        True if the callback was registered, false if not.

      • registerInputCallback

        <T extends IInputCallback> boolean registerInputCallback(T callback,
                                                         Class<T> callbackType)
        Registers the given callback for the given type, if possible. Registration will not be possible if the callback type is not supported.
        Parameters:
        callback -
        callbackType -
        Returns:
        True if the callback was registered, false if not.

      • registerInputCallbackOrFail

        void registerInputCallbackOrFail(IInputCallback callback)
                          throws InputCallbackException
        Registers the given callback if possible. Registration will fail with an exception if the callback does not implement any supported types.
        Parameters:
        callback -
        Throws:
        InputCallbackException - If the callback type is not supported.

      • unregisterInputCallback

        boolean unregisterInputCallback(IInputCallback callback)
        Unregisters the given callback for all types.
        Parameters:
        callback -
        Returns:
        True if the callback was registered before, false if not.

      • unregisterInputCallback

        <T extends IInputCallback> boolean unregisterInputCallback(T callback,
                                                           Class<T> callbackType)
        Unregisters the given callback for the given type.
        Parameters:
        callback -
        callbackType -
        Returns:
        True if the callback was registered before, false if not.

      • hasInputCallback

        boolean hasInputCallback(IInputCallback callback)
        Checks if the given callback is registered as any type.
        Parameters:
        callback -
        Returns:
        True if the callback is registered, false if not.

      • hasInputCallback

        <T extends IInputCallback> boolean hasInputCallback(T callback,
                                                    Class<T> callbackType)
        Checks if the given callback is registered as the given type.
        Parameters:
        callback -
        callbackType -
        Returns:
        True if the callback is registered, false if not.
